sections.MISSION:
1/2CR Master SUAS Trainers conduct a quadcopter (Skydio X2D) familiarization training from 04-05 April 2024 at the Vilseck Army Air Field (VAAF) IOT certify operators from other Squadron’s ISO Saber Strike 24.
Commander’s
sections.PURPOSE: Certifying operators from other Squadrons within the Regiment and additional adjacent units expands the scope of SUAS capabilities, facilitating additional realism in maneuver training and combat readiness.

Conduct academic instruction
Conduct hands-on familiarization with the flight systems
Conduct training flights
4) Conduct dropping flights
sections.END STATE:
2/2CR, 3/2CR, and the 173rd IBCT(A) all have operators who are certified to fly the Skydio X2D quadcopter.
Training Objectives
1. Teach basics of sUAS to students.​
2. Improve knowledge and understanding of the Skydio system.​
3. Instruct students on proper safety practices with the Skydio.​
4. Demonstrate how to properly fly Skydio system.​
5. Students practice flying the Skydio on VAAF.​

subtasks.hazard: SKYDIO (UAS) COLLISION DURING LAUNCH, FLIGHT, OR LANDING

values: Prior to deploying or recovering any UAS, the UAS operators will inspect the area and ensure that a clear takeoff and landing lane is available
The UAS operators will communicate with personnel on the ground to ensure that the area is clear and that no unauthorized personnel are present in the launch or landing area.
The UAS operators will follow proper launch and landing procedures and utilize appropriate safety measures to prevent collisions and other hazards during UAS operators.
All UAS operators will receive training on proper UAS operations and safety procedures prior to conducting any UAS operations.
All UAS operations will be conducted in accordance with applicable regulations and guidelines to ensure safe and effective operations.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: I assess the overall risk to be low with the implemented control measures. Most Dangerous Risk: Total loss of Skydio system during training eventMitigation: Supervisors continuously monitor Soldiers for weather related injuries and water. Soldiers given safety brief on weather. Vehicle warming area if needed.Most Likely Risk: Equipment LossMitigation: Ensuring proper PCCs/PCIs take place before, during, and after launch. A weather assessment will be conducted by both the OIC and RSO to mitigate flying in high winds. The UAS operator will continually communicate the location of aircraft to personal on-ground and avoid flying during limited visibility. UAF will have a US Solider present during all portions of flight operation.
